page.title: 06BUILTH (W): FARMING
page.content: The main occupation locally is farming.The farms are generally family -run and average 150 to 250 acres in size.Increased government grants in recent years have allowed more machinery to be bought and contractor are now brought in : to lay farm roads or to clear woodland and hedges.Some older farms still have dipping tubs.(where sheep are ducked in insecticide,to prevent sheep scab),which drain into streams.This offends conservationalists.Sheep are shorn from mid June onwards,the wool being sent to factories,to be processed.The breeds of sheep include,Beulah Speckled Face,Suffolk and Welsh Mountain.There are some beef cattle:Hereford and Charolais bulls.There is a weekly market in Builth,on Mondays,and the Royal Welsh Show,held annually,at the end of July.
